97.heading: Fontes, Justine.
97.title: A Peanuts Valentine
97.author: based on the comic strips by Charles M
97.appears_in: Schulz ; adapted by Justine and Ron Fontes ; art adapted by Tom Brannon.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Open the envelopes on each page to see what the Peanuts gang is up to as once more Charlie Brown tries to give the little red-haired girl that he has a crush on a Valentine's card.

98.heading: Fontes, Ron, 1952-
98.title: Demi the Demoness Meets Captain Fortune One-Shot
98.author: S

99.heading: Fontes, Ron, 1952-
99.title: Here's to You, America!
99.author: by Charles M
99.appears_in: Schulz ; adapted by Justine and Ron Fontes ; cover art adapted by Paige Braddoc ; interior art adapted by Peter and Nick LoBianco.
notes: "Based on the television episode 'The Birth of the Constitution' from the miniseries 'This is America, Charlie Brown' produced by Lee Mendelson and Bill Melendez."
"Adapted from the works of Charles M. Schulz."

Summary (from OCLC): It's 1787, and the Peanuts gang are in colonial Pennsylvania for the founding of the United States. Along with George Washington and John Hancock, they witness the birth of the Constitution and the creation of the government that makes our country unique. The gang has a lot of reasons why they're proud to be Americans.
